intro: Gnidia kraussiana var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant features a woody stem with hairy foliage, which is a defining trait of the varietal form pubescens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. The flowers bloom in late spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
